article.paragraph: Politics of the Cayman IslandsThepolitics of the Cayman Islandstakes place within a framework ofparliamentary democracy, within the confines of theGovernment of the Cayman Islands.
article.heading: Constitutional Modernisation
article.paragraph: Constitutional Modernisation has come to the forefront of politics recently with the collapse of the now defunctEuro Bank Corporationin 2003. The prosecution in the trial was forced to reveal that theGovernment of the United KingdomBritish Governmenthad plantedMole (espionage)moles(and used wire taps) throughout the banking industry usingMI6, with the consent of theGovernor of the Cayman IslandsGovernor. This caused the trial's collapse, and subsequent release of those charged with wrongdoing. Along with this, the only mole that was known at the time was allowed to leave the country, never to answer for what he (or the United Kingdom) was doing. This infuriated the elected members of the Legislative Assembly as they maintained that the Governor and the United Kingdom had put into question the Cayman Islands' reputation as a tightly regulated offshore jurisdiction. Some saw this as the United Kingdom meddling in the territory's affairs to benefit itself (and the EU), at the expense of the islands' economy.Citation neededNovember 2010

Constitutional talks however went on hold followingHurricane Ivanin 2004. Subsequently in May 2005 the ruling UDP was ousted by the PPM, which restarted the process of constitutional modernisation. The new constitution took effect on 6 November 2009.Citation neededNovember 2010
